controller

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    The controller for a game. Sends messages to map, Saves Data, Loads Data, sets up players, calculate which map is needed, sends messages to the enemy team factory, etc.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  GameController.MoveDirection
      A private Enum class, helps with movement.

      • getUnitOnMap

        public Unit getUnitOnMap(int r,
                         int c)
        Used when selecting a unit from the GUI. If the Unit is there and can move, set it to be the current. Return the unit, or null.
        Parameters:
        r - , the row
        c - , the column
        Returns:
        the current Unit

      • move

        public void move()
        Move a selected Unit to a another space. Checks to see if the player can move to the targeted space, and if can, move them.
        Parameters:
        sr - , the starting row
        sc - , the starting column
        er - , the ending row
        ec - , the ending column

        private boolean SameTeam()
        Check to see if units are on the same team. If they are, return true.
        Returns:

      • inAttackRange

        private boolean inAttackRange(int row,
                              int col)
        Simply check if the enemy is in range. Range is based on the four cardinal directions.
        Returns:
        If the current unit is in range of the target.

      • actAttack

        private void actAttack()
        Actually attack the target. Only called if the currUnit can attack the targeted one.

      • useItem

        public boolean useItem()
        TODO Finish this method Use the item of a selected unit.
        Returns:
        if the item was used.

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Checks both of the player's aliveUnits to see if all of their units are dead. If either of them are out of units they can move, return true and end the game. Checked after every move and attack.
        Returns:
        if the game is over or not

        TODO FINISH
        Returns:
        Depending on the game type, if the game has been won

      • getTurns

        public int getTurns()
        Get the number of turns gone through in the game
        Returns:
        the number of turns taken in game

      • unitDoNothing

        public void unitDoNothing()
        This method is used when a player wants to do nothing and end that current unit's turn. Doesn't end the entire turn, just the turn of the currently selected unit.

      • getMap

        public Map getMap()
        Return the map. Used in setting up the GUI with the current game.
        Returns:
        the map of the current game

      • endTurn

        public void endTurn()
        When called, ends a turn. Checks to see whose turn it is, clears the temporary unit list, sets the current unit to null. Sets the can move to false.

      • targetDead

        private void targetDead(int row,
                        int col)
        Checks to see if a specific unit is dead. If it is, remove it from the map and from the alive unit lists in the associated team.
        Parameters:
        row -
        col -

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks to see if the game is over. If it is, return true;
        Returns:
        if the game is over or not

      • playerWon

        public boolean playerWon()
        Called upon to check if the player has won. Returns true if the player wins the game.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the game has won

      • playerTurn

        public boolean playerTurn()
        Checks to see if the Player is currently moving. If the player is, return true.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the player is moving.
